title: How to Make a Maze Using a Word Processor

steps.headline: Launch your word processor and create a new document.
Create a table.
steps.description: Click on the "Table" menu and select "Insert", then "Table...".

steps.headline: Set the number of columns and number of rows to "20" each.
Choose a fixed column width of "0.2" inches and click on "Ok".
steps.description: Otherwise, resize the table's width to make the cells square.

steps.headline: Highlight boxes to make a path.
Merge these cells by right-clicking on the selection and choosing "Merge Cells".
steps.description: You'll only be able to merge cells within one column or one row at a time.

steps.headline: Remove borders from your paths to join them.Select a path you made where you need to open one or more sides.
Experiment by adding graphics or clip art.
steps.description: You'll soon have a great maze!

steps.headline: Print your maze to paper and share with friends.
steps.description: See how quickly they can get through your maze.

text:
Launch your word processor and create a new document. Create a table. Click on the "Table" menu and select "Insert", then "Table...". Set the number of columns and number of rows to "20" each. Choose a fixed column width of "0.2" inches and click on "Ok". Otherwise, resize the table's width to make the cells square. Highlight boxes to make a path. Merge these cells by right-clicking on the selection and choosing "Merge Cells". You'll only be able to merge cells within one column or one row at a time. Remove borders from your paths to join them.Select a path you made where you need to open one or more sides. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/d/de/Make-a-Maze-Using-a-Word-Processor-Step-7Bullet1.jpg/v4-460px-Make-a-Maze-Using-a-Word-Processor-Step-7Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"/images/thumb/d/de/Make-a-Maze-Using-a-Word-Processor-Step-7Bullet1.jpg/aid10827-v4-728px-Make-a-Maze-Using-a-Word-Processor-Step-7Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":"728","bigHeight":"546","licensing":"

"} Experiment by adding graphics or clip art. You'll soon have a great maze! Print your maze to paper and share with friends. See how quickly they can get through your maze.
